intro: Schoenoplectiella heptangularis, commonly known as the seven-sided sedge, is a flowering plant species native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered flowers. It typically grows in wetland or marshy environments, adapting to saturated soil conditions. Its unique seven-sided stem is a distinguishing feature in its morphology.
